name: dify
title: Dify
description: Access, manage and interact with your Dify AI applications directly within Raycast.
author: lysonober

commands.name: list-dify
commands.title: List Dify
commands.subtitle: Dify
commands.description: Helps you list and manage all Dify apps saved in Raycast.

commands.name: add-dify
commands.title: Add Dify
commands.subtitle: Dify
commands.description: Add a new Dify application with API endpoint and key to Raycast.

commands.name: ask-dify
commands.title: Send to Dify
commands.subtitle: Dify
commands.description: Send queries to your Dify applications and get intelligent responses

commands.name: ask-dify-history
commands.title: View Conversations
commands.subtitle: Dify
commands.description: View and manage your conversation history with Dify applications

tools.name: list-dify-apps
tools.title: Dify Apps Finder
tools.description: List and search for your Dify applications using natural language. Examples: 'Show all my Dify apps', 'Find an app called ChatGPT', 'Do I have an app named Assistant?'

tools.name: explain-dify-app
tools.title: Dify App Explainer
tools.description: Get detailed explanations of your Dify applications including capabilities, input requirements, and usage examples. Examples: 'Explain how to use ChatGPT app', 'Tell me about my Assistant app', 'What inputs does my Text Generator app need?'

tools.name: ask-dify
tools.title: Dify Query Tool
tools.description: Send queries to your Dify applications with intelligent app selection and parameter validation. You need to use Tool:list-dify-apps first or based on the chat history to find the appropriate app, and then you use the api endpoint, key, and inputs description of that app and user's input to generate the right api call input.

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
